intro: Dendrorkis odorata, commonly known as the sweet-scented tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a pleasant, sweet scent when crushed. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are clustered in terminal inflorescences.
